intro: Ceropegia peschii, commonly known as the Madagascar moonvine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, pale yellow or greenish flowers that are often clustered in loose inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a fine layer of white hairs. Ceropegia peschii is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water.
